alert.note: Alert for Covington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 6:13PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL COVINGTON AND NORTHEASTERN OKALOOSA COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM CDT... At 612 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Laurel Hill, or 10 miles west of Florala, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laurel Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
